title: Two pipes can fill a tank in 18 minutes and 15 minutes. An outlet pipe can empty the tank in 45 minutes. If all the pipes are opened when the tank is empty, then how many minutes will it take to fill the tank? - Quora

response.answer_text: Given, Two inlet pipes with capacity to fill a tank in 18 minutes and 15 minutes; and 3rd pipe is an outlet pipe which can empty the tank in 45 minutes. Since, when all the pipes will be open at the same time, the time taken over all to fill the tank will be calculated as follows: [math](1/18)+(1/15)-(1/45)[/math] Here 1/18 is pipe 1’s rate of filling the 1 unit of tank in 18 minutes, 1/15 is pipe 2’s rate of filling the 1 unit of tank in 15 minutes, and 1/45 is pipe 3’s rate of emptying the 1 unit of tank in 45 minutes The answer after calculation will be: 9/90 = 1/10 = 1 unit of tank/10 minutes So, it will take 10 minutes to fill a tank.

Real Practical Application on a 100 litre capacity tank A can fill the tank in 18 minutes (100 litres divide by 18 = 5.555 litres per minute B can fill the tank in 15 minutes (100 litres divide by 15 = 6.666 litres per minute C = Combined filling rates of A & B =12.221 Filling litres per minute. D 100 litres divide by 12.221 litres per minute = 8.18 minutes. E Empty Rate is 100 litres in 45 minutes = 2.222 litres per minute S = Summary 12.221 litres per minute filing rate - 2.222 emptying rate = 10 litres per minute = 10 minutes to fill the tank. Answer: It would take 10 minutes with all valves in the open position.

(1/18)+(1/15)-(1/45) = [(15x45)+(18x45)-(18x15)]/(18x15x45) = [675+810–270]/(18x15x45) = 1215/(18x15x45) = 1/10 So if all the three pipes are open together, 1/10th of the tank will be filled in 1 minute. Or the tank will be filled in 10 minutes if all the three pipes are open simultaneously.

simple rate problem. One pipe has a capacity 1/18 of a tank and the other has 1/15 of a tank in a minute and the drain has -1/45 of a tank in one minute. The common denominator is 90, the equation is (5/90 + 6/90 -2/90) * t= one tank. 9/90 *t=1 then t= 10 minutes
Tank will be filled in 1 min.=1/18 +1/15 - 1/45 = 9/90 So tank will be filled in = 90/9 = 10 min.
